novice.answer: A motivating operation that changes the value of a reinforcer.

sections.title: Overview of ABC
content: Applied Behavior Analysis uses the Antecedent–Behavior–Consequence model to understand why behavior occurs and how it is influenced.

sections.title: Antecedents & Stimulus Control
content: Antecedents are events that occur before behavior. Stimulus control occurs when behavior happens more in the presence of a specific stimulus.

sections.title: Defining Behavior
content: Behavior must be observable, measurable, and objective. Avoid emotional or subjective language when defining behavior.

sections.title: Consequences
content: Consequences follow behavior and affect the likelihood of its future occurrence. Reinforcement increases behavior; punishment decreases it.

sections.title: Functions of Behavior
content: Behaviors typically serve one of four functions: escape, attention, access to tangibles, or sensory stimulation.

sections.title: Putting It All Together
content: By analyzing antecedents and consequences together, we can make informed decisions about behavior function and intervention strategies.
